AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Cilia beat frequency, decreased; KE: Cilia active area, decreased; part of oxidative stress AOP network
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human bronchial epithelial cells (MucilAir™) cultured at air-liquid interface (ALI); exposed to heated tobacco aerosol or cigarette smoke over 28 days (16, 32, or 48 puffs per exposure)
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Video microscopy with automated analysis. Cilia beat frequency (Hz) and active area (%) measured using SAVA (SAVA software). Imaging at 37°C, controlled humidity. Measurements taken at multiple timepoints across 28-day exposure period.
Output / Measurement: Cilia beat frequency (Hz); Cilia active area (%); changes over time with repeated exposure
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Donor anatomical region (bronchial); cell model type (MucilAir™); days at ALI; exposure regimen (puffs, concentration); temperature; imaging timepoints; analysis software version; replicate number; baseline measurements
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Chapman et al. (2023). Twenty-eight day repeated exposure of human 3D bronchial epithelial model to heated tobacco aerosols indicates decreased toxicological responses compared to cigarette smoke. Toxicol Rep.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include video microscopy settings, SAVA software parameters, imaging interval, temperature control, field of view selection, quality control metrics for beat detection
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: video microscopy assay; Mapping: KE for cilia beat frequency decrease; Metadata: temperature, software version, exposure conditions

KE / Domain: Cilia beat frequency and active area (decreased)
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Cilia beat frequency, decreased; KE: Cilia active area, decreased; associated with oxidative stress and inflammatory response
Input (manipulation / sample): Human 3D airway epithelium (MucilAir™) at ALI; repeated exposure to electronic vapor product aerosol or cigarette smoke
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Automated video microscopy for ciliary function assessment. Measures beat frequency (Hz) and percentage of active ciliated area using automated analysis software. Temperature controlled at 37°C.
Output / Measurement: Cilia beat frequency (Hz); Percentage of ciliated area exhibiting motility
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell model (MucilAir™); donor information; days at ALI; exposure protocol (dose, duration, frequency); temperature; imaging parameters; software version; baseline function; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Czekala et al. (2021). Multi-endpoint analysis of human 3D airway epithelium following repeated exposure to whole electronic vapor product aerosol or cigarette smoke.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document imaging protocol, beat detection algorithm, quality control for motion artifacts, temperature maintenance, field selection criteria
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: microscopy assay; Mapping: cilia function KE; ENVO: culture environment; temporal dynamics of exposure response

AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Cilia beat frequency; supports assessment of mucociliary clearance function
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary HAEC at ALI or ex vivo tissue; μOCT system (~1-2 µm axial resolution)
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Micro-Optical Coherence Tomography (μOCT). Non-contact, cross-sectional imaging measuring ciliary beat frequency (CBF) from motion patterns in real-time imaging. System provides simultaneous assessment of tissue microanatomy and ciliary function.
Output / Measurement: Ciliary beat frequency (Hz); ciliary motion patterns; mucociliary transport velocity
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Donor anatomical region; tissue type (cultured vs ex vivo); days at ALI for cultures; system axial/lateral resolution; frame rate; imaging depth; temperature; analysis algorithm; calibration method
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Liu et al. (2013). Method for quantitative study of airway functional microanatomy using micro-optical coherence tomography. PLoS One. 8(1):e54473.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Provide μOCT system configuration, imaging parameters (frame rate, resolution), calibration routine, analysis algorithm for extracting CBF from motion signals, quality control metrics
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: optical coherence tomography assay; Mapping: CBF measurement; Metadata: resolution, frame rate, temperature, non-contact imaging advantage

KE / Domain: Cilia beat frequency and mucociliary transport — intranasal μOCT
AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Cilia beat frequency; KE: Mucociliary clearance; application to cystic fibrosis studies
Input (manipulation / sample): Ex vivo human nasal tissue; in vivo intranasal imaging; μOCT probe for clinical use
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Intranasal micro-Optical Coherence Tomography (μOCT). Minimally invasive imaging of airway surface in vivo. Measures ciliary beat frequency, mucociliary transport rate, and airway surface liquid properties simultaneously. High-resolution cross-sectional imaging.
Output / Measurement: Ciliary beat frequency (Hz); Mucociliary transport rate (mm/min); Airway surface liquid depth (µm); Periciliary layer depth (µm)
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Anatomical site (nasal); subject/donor characteristics; disease state (CF vs healthy); environmental conditions; probe positioning; imaging duration; frame rate; analysis software version; motion artifact correction
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Leung et al. (2019). Intranasal micro-optical coherence tomography imaging for cystic fibrosis studies. Sci Transl Med. 11(504).
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include probe specifications, imaging protocol, patient positioning, motion correction algorithms, CBF extraction methods, quality assessment criteria, safety considerations for in vivo use
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: optical coherence tomography assay; Mapping: CBF, mucociliary clearance KEs; Clinical translation; in vivo imaging capability

AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Cilia number, decreased; KE: Cilia length, decreased; p73 regulation of multiciliogenesis
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human airway epithelial cells at ALI; mouse tracheal epithelial cells; p73 knockout models
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Immunofluorescence microscopy for cilia quantification. Acetylated α-tubulin staining for cilia visualization. Confocal microscopy for cilia counting and length measurement. FoxJ1 staining for ciliated cell identification.
Output / Measurement: Number of cilia per cell; Cilia length (µm); Percentage of ciliated cells; FoxJ1 expression levels
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell type and species; culture conditions; days at ALI; p73 genotype; staining protocol; microscopy type (confocal vs widefield); image analysis method; cell counting criteria; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Marshall et al. (2016). p73 is required for multiciliogenesis and regulates the Foxj1-associated gene network. Cell Reports. 14(10):2289-300.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include immunofluorescence staining protocol, antibody specifications, imaging parameters, cilia counting methodology, length measurement criteria, quality control for complete cell coverage
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: immunofluorescence assay; Mapping: cilia number/length KE; CHEBI: antibody reagents; p73-FoxJ1 regulatory pathway

AOP entity (KE/KER): KE: Ciliated cell differentiation; relationship between FoxJ1 expression and cilia development
Input (manipulation / sample): Primary human airway epithelial cells at ALI; lineage tracing experiments
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Immunohistochemistry and confocal microscopy for FoxJ1 and cilia markers. Acetylated tubulin for mature cilia. Time-course analysis of differentiation. Cell counting and quantification of ciliated vs goblet cell populations.
Output / Measurement: Percentage FoxJ1+ cells; Percentage acetylated tubulin+ (ciliated) cells; Cilia density; Cell type ratios
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Donor source; passage number; differentiation medium; days at ALI; time-course sampling points; antibodies used; imaging parameters; cell counting methodology; statistical analysis approach
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Turner et al. (2012). Goblet cells are derived from a FoxJ1-expressing progenitor in a human airway epithelium. Dev Cell. 22(4):821-9.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include differentiation protocol, immunostaining procedures, imaging acquisition settings, cell classification criteria, time-course design, quantification methods
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: immunohistochemistry assay; Mapping: ciliated cell differentiation; FoxJ1 as marker; developmental trajectory data
